SEARCH
Package nl.pim16aap2.animatedarchitecture.core.structures.structurearchetypes

Interface IDiscreteMovement

All Known Implementing Classes:
Portcullis, SlidingDoor
public interface IDiscreteMovement
Describes a type of structure that moves in a straight line, where the final position of each block in a structure after an animation can be calculated by adding or subtracting the same 'distance' value (measured in blocks as integer value) to its starting position. The dimension(s) along which this is applied is up to the structure type itself to define.

An example of a structure type with discrete movement is a portcullis, as that only goes straight up and straight down.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getBlocksToMove()
    Get the number of blocks this AbstractStructure will try to move.
    void
    setBlocksToMove(int newBTM)
    Change the number of blocks this AbstractStructure will try to move when opened.

  • Method Details

    • getBlocksToMove

      int getBlocksToMove()
      Get the number of blocks this AbstractStructure will try to move. As explained at setBlocksToMove(int), the AbstractStructure is not guaranteed to move as far as specified.
      Returns:
      The number of blocks the AbstractStructure will try to move.

    • setBlocksToMove

      void setBlocksToMove(int newBTM)
      Change the number of blocks this AbstractStructure will try to move when opened. Note that this is only a suggestion. It will never move more blocks than possible. Values less than 1 will use the default value for this AbstractStructure.
      Parameters:
      newBTM - The number of blocks the AbstractStructure will try to move.
